sen.j: 細川 頼元（ほそかわ よりもと、興国4年/康永2年（1343年） - 応永4年5月7日 (旧暦)（1397年6月2日））は、室町時代の幕府管領。
sen.e: Yorimoto HOSOKAWA (1343 - June 2, 1397) was a Bakufu Kanrei (shogunal deputy) during the Muromachi Period.

sen.j: 細川頼之や細川頼有の異母弟で、頼之の養子となる。
sen.e: Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA and Yoriari HOSOKAWA were half brothers (born to different mothers) and Yoriyuki became an adopted son.

sen.j: 1379年(康暦元/天授 (日本)5)に、管領である兄の細川頼之が斯波氏を中心とするクーデター・康暦の政変で失脚すると、兄とともに四国へ下るが、翌年に頼之が将軍足利義満から赦免されると1391年（明徳2/元中7）に斯波義将に代わり管領となる。
sen.e: In 1379 Yorimoto`s elder brother Yoriyuki HOSOKAWAwas overthrown in a coup d`etat (sponsored by the Shiba Clan) which lead to a shift in power to the Northern Court whereupon Yorimoto departed for the island of Shikoku with Yoriyuki but, during the following year, Yoriyuki was pardoned by the shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA and, in 1391 there was a shift in leadership from Yoshimasa SHIBA whereupon Yoriyuki took control.

In 1379 Yorimoto`s elder brother Yoriyuki HOSOKAWAwas overthrown in a coup d`etat (sponsored by the Shiba Clan) which lead to a shift in power to the Northern Court whereupon Yorimoto departed for the island of Shikoku with Yoriyuki but, during the following year, Yoriyuki was pardoned by the shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA and, in 1391 there was a shift in leadership from Yoshimasa SHIBA whereupon Yoriyuki took control.

In 1379 Yorimoto's older brother Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA was overthrown in a coup d'etat, the Koryaku Coup, whereupon Yorimoto departed for the island of Shikoku with Yoriyuki but, during the following year, Yoriyuki was pardoned by the shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA and, in 1391 there was a shift in the post of kanrei (shogunal deputy) from Yoshimasa SHIBA whereupon Yoriyuki took control.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを修正しました。elder→older,sponsored→led,Clan→clan, leadership→the post of kanrei (shogunal deputy) と修正しました。the を修正しました。文の中ほどを文脈に応じて修正しました。

sen.j: 頼元以後も細川氏は三管領の1つとして室町幕府の管領を務める家柄となる。
sen.e: Subsequently, Yorimoto was one of 3 in the Hosokawa family line to serve as deputies to the Shogun during the Muromachi shogunate.
Subsequently, Yorimoto was one of 3 in the Hosokawa family line to serve as deputies to the Shogun during the Muromachi shogunate.

Subsequently, the Hosokawa clan continued to serve in the kanrei post of the Muromachi bakfu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) as one of the Sankanrei (three families in the post of kanrei, or shogunal deputy) after Yorimoto.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて全体的に修正しました。

sen.e: Died in 1397 aged 54.
